content.text:
# PMPC Star Awards for Music

| year2 =
| website =
}}
PMPC Star Awards for Music is an annual award ceremony recognizing outstanding music industries in the Philippines. It is organized by the Philippine Movie Press Club (PMPC), an organization of tabloid reporters founded in 2009.
History
After the major success of award ceremonies of film and television counterparts, the Philippine Movie Press Club (PMPC) led by overall chairman Roldan F. Castro, and the Alyansa ng mga Filipinong Mamamahayag (AFIMA) () originally formed the award-giving ceremony to recognize the music industries in the Philippines. The inaugural award ceremony was held at Skydome, SM City North EDSA, in Quezon City on October 29, 2009.

Award categories
Competetitive awards
Active awards
* Male Recording Artist of the Year
* Female Recording Artist of the Year
* Male Pop Artist of the Year
* Female Pop Artist of the Year
* New Male Recording Artist of the Year
* New Female Recording Artist of the Year
* Duo/Group Artist of the Year
* Music Video of the Year
* Pop Album of the Year
* Revival Album of the Year
* Dance Album/Recording of the Year
* Rock Album of the Year
* Rock Artist of the Year
* Male Acoustic Artist of the Year
* Female Acoustic Artist of the Year
* Rap Artist of the Year
* Novelty Artist of the Year
* Novelty Song of the Year
* R&B Male Artist of the Year
* R&B Female Artist of the Year
* Collaboration of the Year
* New Group Artist of the Year
}}
Retired awards
* Acoustic Artist of the Year
* Album Cover Design of the Year
* Alternative Album of the Year
* Duo/Group Concert Performer of the Year
* Folk/Country Recording of the Year
* Jazz Artist of the Year
* Male Rock Artist of the Year
* Female Rock Artist of the Year
}}
Special awards
;Pilita Corrales Lifetime Achievement Award
* 2009: APO Hiking Society
* 2010: Pilita Corrales
* 2011: Nora Aunor
* 2012: Jose Mari Chan
* 2013: Freddie Aguilar
* 2014: Lea Salonga
* 2015: Rey Valera
* 2017: Imelda Papin
* 2018: Basil Valdez
* 2020: Regine Velasquez

* 2024 (15th): Vernie Varga
